pageProps.content:
Experience

Linyanti Ebony Camp is set in a private concession on the banks of the Linyanti Marsh, adjacent to its sister, Linyanti Bush Camp.
Because the marshes are the only water source for miles around, the camp experiences a fantastic variety of wildlife making their way to camp in search of water.

Stay

Linyanti Ebony Camp is small & consists of only 4 spacious en-suite safari tents, all built on elevated decks ensuring stunning views of the endless vistas & lagoons of the Linyanti River system. One of these 4 tents consists of 2-bedrooms, & is ideal for families travelling with small children.
The camps’ main area includes a dining & lounge area looking out over a sparkling swimming pool. For large groups or families, Linyanti Ebony & Linyanti Bush Camps can be booked together on request for groups of up to 20 people.

Activities

A safari to Botswana is not complete without experiencing both land & water activities. Linyanti Ebony Camp offers both, including open game drives in 4x4 safari vehicles, walking excursions with a qualified guide as well as boating & mokoro trips on the waterways of the beautiful Okavango Delta. Fishing can also be enjoyed.
Because the camp is set in a private concession, off-road driving is permitted which means that animals can be followed for miles on end. Nocturnal animals are frequently spotted on night drives.

subfolders.title: Camp Linyanti
subfolders.description: Camp Linyanti is a water wonderland & located in the uncrowded north-western corner of Chobe National Park.   The camp is all about offering guests a raw safari experience, so guests who favour safari quality over luxury accommodation will feel right at home. A safari to Camp Linyanti is small & intimate.  There are only 5 Meru-style safari tents with elevated wooden decks, allowing only a maximum of 10 guests in camp at a time.  One of these tents is ideal for honeymooners looking for a bit more privacy.

subfolders.title: DumaTau
subfolders.description: In the heart of the private 125,000-hectare Linyanti Wildlife Reserve, you will find DumaTau.  This luxury tented camp is situated close to the source of the Savute Channel on one of the Linyanti lagoons.   Wildlife viewing at DumaTau is fantastic.  The region has a great variety of animals, a highlight being the massive herds of elephants congregating around the waterways & lagoons during the winter months. There are 7 luxury tents as well as a 2-bedroom family unit, ideal for parents travelling with young children.  Each tent has a private plunge pool & a comfortable lounge, & feature a bathroom with indoor & outdoor showers.

subfolders.title: King's Pool
subfolders.description: King’s Pool is set in the beautiful Linyanti Wildlife Reserve in the northern part of Botswana.  The Linyanti Reserve is a private concession located on the western boundary of the Chobe National Park, ensuring spectacular wildlife viewing. What makes King’s Pool great, is the camp’s unique location on the banks of the Linyanti River.  Excellent game viewing can be experienced around the riverbed, allowing guests to sit on the deck while enjoying wildlife activity in or around the river. King’s Pool has 7 luxurious canvas tents as well as a 2-bedroom suite, ideal for families.  Each tent is equipped with a bedroom, lounge, private plunge pool & sala.  A lovely touch in the en-suite bathrooms is the double showers & hand-basins, as well as an outdoor shower for those who wish to get close to nature.

subfolders.title: Lagoon Camp
subfolders.description: Kwando Lagoon Camp is perched on the banks of the wild Kwando River in Botswana’s Linyanti concession, overlooking the Namibian Caprivi strip. Lagoon Camp has a well-earned reputation for big game & large herds of elephants & buffaloes, especially in the dryer winter months when herds of up to a thousand are not uncommon. The camp is nestled between towering trees & consists of 8 traditionally styled safari tents, each with an en-suite bathroom including indoor & outdoor shower as well as a private deck & spacious living area, all offering picturesque views over the river.  One of these tents also comprises a second bedroom with twin beds, ideal for families.

subfolders.title: Lebala Camp
subfolders.description: Kwando Lebala Camp is situated in the southern region of the Kwando concession in Botswana, adjacent to the Linyanti marshes that form the boundary between Botswana & Namibia. The Kwando River disappears into the marshland before emerging as the Linyanti River, an important source of life to a wide variety of animals & birds. Lebala means ‘wide open spaces’ in Setswana & after visiting, it is not surprising to see why.  The scenery is dominated by vast plains with scattered palms & tree islands backed by wooden savannahs.

subfolders.title: Linyanti Bush Camp
subfolders.description: Linyanti Bush Camp is situated on the banks of the Linyanti Marsh in a private reserve, which borders the western boundary of Chobe in the Chobe Enclave.   Being the only water source for miles around, the marshes attract water-adapted & desert-adapted wildlife, including large populations of elephants & buffaloes.  The area also offers spectacular birding all year round. Linyanti Bush Camp consists of 6 luxury tents, each with en-suite facilities, sofa & writing desk.  The tents are all positioned to offer spectacular views of the Linyanti Marsh, ensuring an up, close & personal encounter with Africa’s wildest animals.

subfolders.title: Linyanti Ebony Camp
subfolders.description: Linyanti Ebony Camp is set in a private concession on the banks of the Linyanti Marsh, adjacent to its sister, Linyanti Bush Camp.   Because the marshes are the only water source for miles around, the camp experiences a fantastic variety of wildlife making their way to camp in search of water. Linyanti Ebony Camp is small & consists of only 4 spacious en-suite safari tents, all built on elevated decks ensuring stunning views of the endless vistas & lagoons of the Linyanti River system.  One of these 4 tents consists of 2-bedrooms, & is ideal for families travelling with small children.

subfolders.title: Linyanti Tented Camp
subfolders.description: Linyanti Tented Camp is located on the iconic Linyanti Marsh, within easy access to a combination of habitats, floodplains, open-dry land savannah & woodland, & therefore attracts large numbers of big game & birds. The camp offers the perfect blend between adventure & luxury, offering guests a thrilling & intimate safari experience.  Families & small groups love to include a stop here since this hugely diverse area not only provides excellent wildlife opportunities but ensures a comfortable night’s rest in luxury tents. Linyanti Tented Camp consists of an East & West wing.  Each wing boasts 4 spacious twin-bedded tents under canvas, each with two three quarter beds, en-suite bathrooms and shaded outdoor decks.

subfolders.title: Savuti Camp
subfolders.description: Set in an isolated part of the Linyanti Concession along the Savute Channel, Savuti Camp has an ideal location – 17 kilometres downstream from the Zibadianja Lagoon, the source of the Savute Channel.   The Channel stopped flowing between 1980 & 2008; during this time it served as a corridor & feeding ground for a wide variety of herbivores.  In 2008, the Savute Channel once more became a deep, clear waterway for animals to congregate & drink, thus ensuring an abundance of game surrounding the camp & front row seats for Savuti’s guests. Accommodation consists of 5 large walk-in tents, raised off the ground & facing the Savute Channel.  All tents are spacious & have en-suite bathrooms.  There is also an additional family tent, consisting of 2 inter-leading bedrooms, each with bathroom & private entrance.

whatWeLoveItems: Spectacular view over the Linyanti Marsh
